body.p:
State of Kentucky
Lewis Circuit Court
2nd day June Term 1863
Commonwealth of Kentucky Plt
Against
Samuel Johnson Deft

This day came the parties by their attorneys, and by consent the arraignment of the prisoner is dispensed with. The defendant, plead not guilty to the indictment, thereupon the following Jurors viz: Jos H. Swearingen, Saml McEldonney, A. W. Fryer, George Rowland Wm W. Frizzell James E White, Wm T. Swearingen, O W. Boyd. Danl E Hendrickson Jas S. Jones. H. A. Shepard Wm N Carr --

who were duly empannelled and sworn. The defendant then asked and obtained leave to withdraw his plea of not guilty, and pleaded guilty to the indictment, and the Jury having heard the evidence &c. returned the following verdict viz. We the Jury find the prisoner guilty and fix his punishment at four years imprisonment in the penitentiary of this state, but recommend him to executive Clemency and pardon on condition of his return to his regiment the 22" Ky Vols. Signed Saml McEldowney Foreman
It is now therefore adjudged that the prisoner be committed to the county Jail --

A Copy
Teste John T. Parker, Clk
Per A. V Wilson D, C,
